info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Haywood County through 645 PM EDT... At 600 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Newport, or 8 miles northwest of Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, Smoky Mountains-Cataloochee, Smoky Mountains-Balsam Mountain, Waterville and Fines Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
